Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2013 02:53PM npetro2803 wrote: Thank you for your responses.  I will be hoping and praying for good results and you have really eased my mind about the procedure itself as I know now a little more of what to expect. I will be thinking of you all and hoping for the best for you.
Posts.Title: Awaiting core biopsy...question(s) npetro2803 fredntan

Posts.Content: npetro2803 wrote: Hi everyone, I am very new here (made an account a minute ago, haha).  My mom had breast cancer in 2008 and underwent chemo, she is now in remission and is fine.  She did not have the genetic marker.  I was diagnosed with thyroid cancer in June of 2011, had a total tyroidectomy and am now on levothyroxine daily.  Due to my mom's breast cancer, and my own experience with thyroid cancer, I asked my ob/gyn for a mammo prescription.  I avoided it for a year until I found a small pea sized lump and decided it was time to go and get everything checked out.  I went Dec. 15.  They told me that since it was the first mammo I should expect to be called back for additional films to get a good baseline reading, and then when I said I found a lump myself, they knew with certainty I would be called back.  So I was, and I went in for four more films and then an ultrasound.  What I felt (and the dr. felt too) appears to be a fat lobule, or nothing that is showing up at all on ultrasound.  However, there is another spot that I never felt that is 10 o'clock and 2 cm from the nipple that "appears" to be a fibroadenoma.  Since they are unsure they are sending me for a core biopsy.  I underwent a fine needle aspiration for the thyroid cancer, and thought it'd be similar, but obviously they are not the same.  My mom said it is "uncomfortable" but I don't know how much she is sparing me or not trying to scare me or ff she really means that or whatever...so, essentially, just wondering what it REALLY feels like.  Thanks in advance, and sorry for not being versed in the abbreviations and such as of yet.  Nicole Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Awaiting core biopsy...question(s) npetro2803 fredntan
